title: Why is there not going to be an option to use the current hud over the new one?
body: I was recently informed that a Rioter confirmed on reddit that there won't be an option to stick with the current hud once the new one rolls out. I understand that the majority of people seem to like it, but is there really something wrong with leaving the option there for those who don't? I find the new hud to be basically unplayable with compared to the current one, even after being exposed to it many times over. The change actually makes the game much more difficult to read and play for me. Odds are, I won't be playing much if at all once that patch comes in. I honestly don't understand why something this important doesn't have an option to stay the same. Can anyone give me some insight on why they decided not to give us the choice on this?

Very simple reason why not: They'd have to continue updating two HUD's... twice the programming to what end?  Make a minority of users happy at a larger cost.

From what I understand (I don't work on the UI, nor am I a software engineer) this is indeed the issue. Having to add new features to two different systems, fix bugs in two different places, test functionality in two different ways etc adds significant extra development time that comes at the cost of getting other work (e.g. new feature development) done instead.

As far as adapting to the new HUD goes I with you trying to play with it can feel disruptive when you're so used to the current one. For whatever it's worth I found most things (e.g. looking to the right instead of left for items) started to feel pretty natural after a few games. There are also a number of changes I've found myself really liking, whether small stuff (being able to check enemy CS without pushing Tab) or larger stuff (opening up the bottom left corner of the screen). I'd certainly suggest giving it some games, even if it feels a bit weird at first.

Hi Meddler, glad to see a bit of insight into the decision. I have a few more questions about this, if you know enough about what's going on in the department that works on this. I'm kind of curious as to why the new hud was suggested in the first place. As far as I can tell, there weren't really any problems with the old one that needed to be changed. 

Honestly, this new one just prevents me from enjoying my time in the game at all after playing with it on the PBE and watching videos from there. Is it possible that the old one could be tested as a secondary option before completely ditching the idea (assuming that hasn't already been done)? I could be wrong, but it seems like a HUD wouldn't be too problematic to leave on the back burner. If it doesn't work at all when they're both in the game, then there's not really much I can complain about. A good portion of the playerbase seems to like it, but I know there are a good few of us who would love to give the old one a chance. Either way, thanks for letting me know a bit about what's going on behind the scenes.

"As far as I can tell, there weren't really any problems with the old one that needed to be changed."

There are many problems with the old one. The lack of information (or difficulty/inconvenience getting to it). The location of information. The use of space (things being too spread out). And a few more but those are just the first few to come to mind. I believe all of this was mentioned in the initial post about the upcoming HUD update but I could be wrong.

We're used to the current HUD. That doesn't mean there isn't a lot wrong with it though. It can be hard to tell what's wrong because it's not a matter of things not working as intended ('broken'). It's a matter of things being a lot lower quality than they could be ('suboptimal'). I know that makes changing it a lot harder to justify to those who like the old way because it's a matter of degree rather than a yes/no situation, but I feel that in this case it is worth it.

In situations like this the transition period is the hardest because the initial difficulty of change happens and often you have to deal with having both systems at once which makes adjusting even harder, such as anyone on the PBE is going through right now. I have faith that Riot will make it at least better than the current live HUD by enough that I'll be satisfied after I get used to the new one and I urge you to have that same faith. I suspect that within a week of it going live almost everyone who pays regularly will be fairly used to it and happy with the update.

[I'm a visual designer, not working on the HUD though]

Usually, the default response is "Give it time, you'll get used to it," but I think that's a little curt. I know it's frustrating to have to learn a new HUD layout. It sucks to change where you look, where you click etc. and telling someone to "deal with it" isn't exactly courteous or productive.

I will instead ask - What don't you like about the new HUD?**

** (WITHOUT using the reason of "It's different" or "I don't want to get used to it")

These reasons are perfectly acceptable reasons for not liking the new HUD, but unfortunately it's something we need to get past in order to get to the core usability issues. If you can clearly articulate what you don't like, then it's feedback we can use.

To be specific to your concerns, what makes the HUD "more difficult to read and play for me"? When you drill down and answers those questions, it's feedback we can use, process, and weigh against other people's feedback. 

An example of SPECIFIC feedback might be:
"As a person who loves to play mid lane, the concentration of UI elements in the bottom right makes me feel more vulnerable to jungle ganks on that side." or something like that. This feedback is self contained and does not rely on comparing it to the old HUD. It's feedback we can use against other contradictory feedback (such as "My bot lane partner and I love that the top HUD leaves plenty of space to watch for jungle activity!")

In that case, I'll be as specific as I can. I generally like my information being spaced out in different areas of the screen, as the more I look around the screen the more likely I am to actually take note of my surroundings in game. Having everything in the middle/bottom is not only too cluttered to read easily, but it doesn't give me incentive to pay attention to the entire game. As a mid player, I've actually noticed ganks coming in from the sides by accident as I glanced at my score when they come into lane. Without anything being up there, it doesn't provide any extra incentive to be attentive. Additionally, it just makes the screen feel empty.

Another huge problem is the new stats menu. It feels out of place and too small compared to the old one. Leaving the entire bottom left open instead of gaps along the bottom is basically giving us useless space to play with. Putting it in the corner ensures that it isn't in the way of anything important, but the placement closer to the center blocks a place that I feel is much more commonly needed. I generally use that for checking stats at a glance, and the full menu for less important things in lane such as CDR and penetration. With it being too small for that, I have to focus more on it instead of getting the information I need without giving up my awareness of what's going on. Having the numbers turn green for altered stats is very important for this too.

As for the minimap, it is already the most important source of information in the game.  Placing score, icons,  and ping directly on it is basically only a distraction when I go to look down there. With the placement of all the information in one portion of the screen, it becomes an information overload. If I go to check the map, then I look at the score and ping, then the champion icons, I'll have spent way more time looking there than I intended to and may even miss out on what's happening around me. Having everything more spread out but in specific groups makes it much easier to find the exact information that I'm looking for while also keeping watch for everything going on. Additionally, the left side of the screen is now barren due to the lack of icons there. That space is nearly worthless in game, and having a portion of the hud there actually made it worth glancing there every now and then. With the update, there is no extra incentive to check that area of the screen.

With the change, I also noticed that the ability icons act differently. I'm consistently confused as to whether my ability is on cooldown or if I'm out of mana. It may have to do with the  cooldown change looking exactly like abilities that you don't have enough mana for on the live hud. For example, when trying the new gangplank while just farming minions with q in a game on my own, I  would instinctively use  mana potions and flask charges after using an ability due to thinking that I ran out of mana rather than just put the ability on cooldown. In laning, that is a very big problem to have.

Items being on the right is something that I will admit isn't incredibly hard to get used to. It still feels very odd having the shop button in the middle of the screen, though. As the shop window is not generally something you want to open in lane, having it so close to all the other important information seems a little odd. There shouldn't be any reason to have that in a place where a bad misclick would leave you unable to see what is going on around you. Admittedly, the current hud is susceptible to that while rearranging items as well, but it is in a more out of the way location.

I will say that the new scoreboard is great. It's the change that everybody wanted, and works pretty well. The only complaint I could have about it is that it follows the new visual theme, which seems to be a worse match for the map than the live hud. Of course, that's just a personal opinion and doesn't really matter much. Hopefully this is usable feedback for you.

Specific feedback? As someone who's more than a little obsessive about certain things, the alignment of the centre console bothers me constantly, in every picture of it I see, and I can imagine it being the same in-game. The fact that the abilities console is designed with items and stats specifically looking like off-shoots (i.e. not a single contiguous panel but three) and yet the abilities panel hasn't been centred on the screen just feels off-balance to me, and has done since I first saw it. It looks uneven, and has done from the start, and that really puts me off my stride.

To clarify: I have no problem with the movement of the key elements of the HUD; I was against moving the items at first but I can see the reasoning behind it and support it. But when everything is being placed into bottom-right, top-left or centre-bottom, it just feels imbalanced to have the centre justified incorrectly in comparison to the design. As someone who could previously click abilities without looking at clutch moments (especially for upgrading abilities as a current issue with logitech peripherals is preventing me from binding modifier keys to allow keyboard skill-ups) I feel like with this, a lot of the time I'm going to be clicking wrong, because Im going to keep moving left or right of centre onto the HUD without considering the alignment until its too late.

Alright here is some specific feedback. There wasn't a problem with the HUD blocking vision, that isn't a thing. It's layout had flow to it, you could easily see whatever information you wanted with NO EFFORT whatsoever. This HUD indirectly blinds you from the entire screen. How? If I want to check some information, it is beside a ton of other things that attract my eyes because I am looking for something. I actually HAVE TO SEARCH for something. Even though I have the layout memorized, everything is located by a bunch of other unrelated things.

The new HUD creates the non-existant problem you were trying to solve. It makes 0 sense. This is why people wanted all their buffs moved to the center of the screen. Here is some examples, comparing the two and the thought process

OLD

-"Whats the status on my allied champions" "I'll just look to the left side of the screen" "His health is at half and his ult is up, he has no mana because he is Garen"

-"Time for my routine map check" "I'll just look to the bottom right corner" "Alright, jungler is top, our bot is pushing, I can go dragon"

-"What are my stats?" "I'll just look to the bottom left" "Ahh those are my stats, and there are the items that give me those, right there beside it"

-"Who is dead right now" "I'll just hit tab" "Enemy Vi and Xerath are down, we can get some stuff done easily"

NEW

-"Whats the status on my allied champions" "I'll look to the right" "That's the score" "Map" "Ahh there they are" "Is that Sona on my team or their team? Its Grey" "I'll just hit tab" "What half of this HUD is my team on?" "I'm playing Udyr" "Oh, there I am" "That Sona is on the enemy team, shes up now though"

-"Time for my routine map check" "I'll look to the bottom right corner" "There are those camera options" "That's the scoreboard" "Check out that pile of gray champion portraits, I wonder which ones are mine" "Everybody seems to be dead, I'll push lanes"

-"What are my stats?" "Bottom of the screen" "Those are my buffs" "Thats my health and mana" "My exp bar" "Hey, thats the champion I'm playing as" "There is that little button down there" "Ah, the tab" "Now which one is my damage?" "Im just gonna mouse over to check" "Ohh there it is" "I'll just close that box up" "What items do I have for that damage?" "There's me again" "My exp bar is purple" "There's my health and mana" "Ahh there is my inventory" "Why is my recall spell over here?"

-"Who is dead right now?" "I'll look to the right" "That's the score" "That's the map" "Ahh there are the champions" "Those 3 are dead" "Are any of those on my team" "I'll hit tab" "What side am I on" "I'll just look for Udyr" "I'm still not seeing him" "There I am" "One of my teammates is dead"

This is supposed to be an improvement. I am completely missing it. "My bot lane partner and I love that the top HUD leaves plenty of space to watch for jungle activity!". This isn't an issue. It really isn't. Even if there are some people that get a little bothered by it, its WAY better than being completely blinded by the fact that you always have to focus at the bottom of the screen.

Just give us the old one back. This is all just unnecessary problems.

My apologies that I'm not responding with a specific "the new HUD could be better if you...." as I know that was what you requested.

However to be 100% honest the biggest reason I've had such a massively negative impression of the new HUD isn't necessarily about the new HUD being new, but rather I felt the old HUD was fantastic.

With there being so many other areas Riot could be focusing on (the Yorick rework, finding out where you want Darius to be, AD itemisation, and many others I'm sure that I am forgetting) I suppose the frustration stems from superfluously overhauling one of the areas I actually felt Riot got right!
